about: The Export Compliance Training Institute is your company's one-stop source for export compliance training.  We offer comprehensive training on US Export Controls (EAR/OFAC, etc) and Defense Trade Controls (ITAR) for your experts through 2 and 4 day live seminars offered throughout the United States and around the world.  Seminar locations include San Diego, Chicago, Phoenix, Austin, Fort Worth, Washington DC, London, Amsterdam, Singapore, Munich, San Francisco, Denver, Miami, Boston and many more.  Our full schedule of live seminars can be found at http://learnexportcompliance.com/schedule.We also offer training through e-Seminars and webinars.  Our e-Learning options are detailed at http://learnexportcompliance.com/elearning.Export Compliance Professional (ECoP® ) Accreditation testing is available for both the EAR and the ITAR and for both live seminar and e-Seminar training.  Details are on our website at http://learnexportcompliance.com/accreditation.ECTI's staffs its seminars speakers who are both knowledgeable and dynamic.General Awareness training is also available.

title: Global Energy Policy Center
sub_title: Climate And Energy Economist, United States
area_of_expertise: Educators/Academics in the United States
about: is the founder and director of the Global Energy Policy Center. Dr. Stoft received his Ph.D. in economics from U.C. Berkeley in 1982. He has been an energy economist since 1987 when he joined the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory. In 2002 he served as the expert economic witness before FERC for California’s Public Utilities Commission in their attempt to recover part of the $40 billion spent on long-term contracts during the electricity crisis. From 2004 to 2006, he helped design ISO?New England’s capacity market.  He has recently published his second book, Carbonomics. In 2002 he published Power System Economics, which has been translated into Chinese and Russian.The Global Energy Policy Center is focused on changing the orientation of global energy policy. The new orientation must be toward strategy and economics rather than toward the targets and timetables, and toward a unification of climate and energy-security policy.

title: University Of Michigan
about: <span 12px;="" border-collapse:="" collapse;="" color:="" #111111;="" line-height:="" 19px;="" -webkit-border-horizontal-spacing:="" 1px;="" -webkit-border-vertical-spacing:="" 1px;"="">Andrei Levchenko is an Assistant Professor of Economics at the University of Michigan, where he has taught since 2008, and a Faculty Research Fellow at the National Bureau of Economic Research. Before coming to Michigan, he was an Economist in the Research Department of the International Monetary Fund and Visiting Assistant Professor at the University of Chicago Graduate School of Business. He earned a Ph.D. in Economics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 2004. Prof. Levchenko’s research focuses on the interactions between globalization, economic development, and macroeconomics.

about: The Graziadio Business Review is an online journal that delivers relevant business information and analysis for business, government, and non-profit managers.Since 1998, the Graziadio Business Report has provided practical information on dealing with business situations and problems. GBR authors translate the latest academic research and analysis into practical applications for business. Articles feature an applied focus and usually answer the "So what?" question.From accounting and finance to ethics and work/life balance, the Graziadio Business Review extends current business debates in new directions that you can use to advance your business and professional career.
